summary: This document is a set of 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for the date August 9, 2019. The sheets record staff checks on inmates in locked-down status, with signatures for each time slot, reviewed by lieutenants and a captain. It is significant as it documents the prison's monitoring procedures on the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody.

persons.name: Morning Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer who reviewed the check sheets for the morning watch shift.

persons.name: Day Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer who reviewed the check sheets for the day watch shift.

persons.name: Evening Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer who reviewed the check sheets for the evening watch shift.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The senior officer who reviewed the completed check sheets.

events.title: MCC New York SHU Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Routine 30-minute checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York were conducted and documented throughout the day.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a prison log showing 30-minute inmate checks at MCC New York's Special Housing Unit on August 9, 2019.
It demonstrates the Bureau of Prisons' protocol for observing inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour.
The log was reviewed by shift lieutenants and a captain, indicating a chain of oversight for inmate monitoring.
The date corresponds to the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the MCC.
